intro: Zosterophyllanthos ruberrimus, commonly known as the crimson zosterophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the zosterophyllales order. It is characterized by its distinctive, ribbon-like leaves that are often reddish in color, which contribute to its common name. The plant exhibits a unique combination of primitive and more advanced vascular features, suggesting a transitional form in plant evolution. It typically grows in shallow marine environments, thriving in coastal areas with high salinity. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for studying early plant adaptation to marine conditions.
